New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: -Between stations within Connecticut -Between Connecticut and New York stations -Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December.

Metro-North's New Year's Eve/Day Holiday Service

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. For New Year's Eve (Thursday, December 31), we will operate a modified weekday AM and PM Peak service, with an early afternoon getaway schedule. - Train consolidations in the AM Peak, extra outbound service between 12 noon and 4 PM, and consolidated service during the PM Peak. - Extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service - "Overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from 12 noon New Year's Eve until 12 noon New Year's Day. On New Year's Eve tickets will be collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Please remember to buy your tickets in advance. On New Year's Day (Friday, January 1, 2016), we will operate hourly service
No Alcohol Allowed during New Year's Holiday

To maintain orderly travel, alcoholic beverages will not be allowed on LIRR trains, platforms & stations from 12 Noon on New Year's Eve (Thurs. Dec. 31) thru 12 Noon on New Year's Day (Fri. Jan. 1, 2016). The MTA Police will enforce this restriction.
LIRR Extra Eastbound Service for New Year's Day

The LIRR will operate 20 extra eastbound early-morning trains for customers returning from New Year's Eve festivities and concerts by Phish at Madison Square Garden and Jimmy Buffett at Barclays Center. The added trains will depart Penn and Atlantic Terminal between 12:35 AM and 4:19 AM on the Babylon, Montauk, Ronkonkoma, Port Jefferson, Port Washington, and Long Beach branches. See http://bit.ly/1ICeaRA for details.
LIRR Extra Westbound Service for New Year's Eve

The LIRR will operate 20 extra westbound trains on Thursday, December 31 between 4:55 PM and 9:05 PM, for customers traveling to New Year's Eve festivities. The added trains will depart station terminals on the Babylon, Montauk, Ronkonkoma, Port Jefferson, Port Washington, Long Beach and Hempstead branches. See http://bit.ly/1ICeaRA for details.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: -Between stations within Connecticut -Between Connecticut and New York stations -Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December.

Metro-North's New Year's Eve/Day Holiday Service

Ring in the New Year with us! Whether you are heading to Times Square or spending a quiet evening with friends, we've got plenty of extra service to get you to and from your holiday celebrations. For New Year's Eve (Thursday, December 31), we will operate a modified weekday AM and PM Peak service, with an early afternoon getaway schedule. - Train consolidations in the AM Peak, extra outbound service between 12 noon and 4 PM, and consolidated service during the PM Peak. - Extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service - "Overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from 12 noon New Year's Eve until 12 noon New Year's Day. On New Year's Eve tickets will be collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Please remember to buy your tickets in advance. On New Year's Day (Friday, January 1, 2016), we will operate hourly service

For New Year's Eve (Thursday, December 31), we will operate a modified weekday AM and PM Peak service, with an early afternoon getaway schedule. -Train consolidations in the AM Peak, extra outbound service between 12 noon and 4 PM, and consolidated service during the PM Peak. -Extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service -"Overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home from your celebrations. For New Year's Eve (Thursday, December 31), we will operate a modified weekday AM and PM Peak service, with an early afternoon getaway schedule. Train consolidations in the AM Peak, extra outbound service between 12 noon and 4 PM, and consolidated service during the PM Peak. Extra inbound late afternoon and early evening service "Overnight" New Year's morning service to get you home from your celebrations. Please remember that drinking alcohol on Metro-North trains and at our stations is banned from 12 noon New Year's Eve until 12 noon New Year's Day. On New Year's Eve tickets will be collected prior to boarding trains at Grand Central. Please remember to buy your tickets in advance. R Line - Weeknight Planned Service Change

Q Line - Weekday Planned Service Change

N Line - Weeknight Planned Service Change

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

SantaCon Alert: Open Alcoholic Beverages Banned From Trains & Stations 5 AM on Sat.- 12 noon on Sun.

To maintain orderly travel during this weekend's "SantaCon" event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and stations from 5 AM on Saturday, December 12, through 12 noon on Sunday, December 13. MTA Police Officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and at train stations and on trains to enforce this restriction. See details at http://bit.ly/1SPWj9R

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

Those traveling to/from the LIRR's Atlantic Terminal in Brooklyn to participate in this weekend's Santa-Con event are reminded that there is no LIRR train service to/from Atlantic Terminal between 1:42AM & 6:22AM. During that period, customers looking to travel to or from Atlantic Terminal can take NYC Transit's No. 2 or 3 lines between Penn Station and Atlantic Terminal.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December.

SantaCon Alert: Open Alcoholic Beverages Banned From Trains & Stations 5 AM on Sat.- 12 noon on Sun.

To maintain orderly travel during this weekend's "SantaCon" event, alcohol will not be permitted on Metro-North trains and stations from 5 AM on Saturday, December 12, through 12 noon on Sunday, December 13. MTA Police Officers will be on duty at Grand Central Terminal and at train stations and on trains to enforce this restriction. See details at http://bit.ly/1SPWj9R
New LIRR Schedules Take Effect Monday, Dec. 14

New timetables take effect Monday, December 14 for all LIRR branches. The new timetables reflect additional Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, and New Year's Day service. For details, pick up a copy of the new timetable for your branch or visit: http://bit.ly/1GU6B4v

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: --Between stations within Connecticut --Between Connecticut and New York stations --Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

New Haven Line Fare Increase Effective on January 1, 2016

A Connecticut Department of Transportation (CTDOT) fare increase of 1% goes into effect on the Connecticut portion of the New Haven Line on January 1, 2016. This is the fifth of seven consecutive annual increases requested by CTDOT to help finance the new M8 cars. This increase will affect ticket prices for travel: - Between stations within Connecticut - Between Connecticut and New York stations - Some fares may not change due to rounding and the small percentage of the increase. The fare increase does not affect travel to/from stations within New York State. Please note: All January 2016 commutation tickets will be sold at the new prices effective Jan. 1, even if purchased in December. See http://bit.ly/1OGwLLh for more info.

7 Line - UPDATED Weekend Planned Service Change

11:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Sat, Dec 4 - 5 No 7 service between Times Sq-42 St and Queensboro Plaza - the E, F, N, Q*, S, and free shuttle buses provide alternate service. 7 service operates in two sections: 1. Between Flushing-Main St and Queensboro Plaza. 2. Between Times Sq-42 St and 34 St-Hudson Yards. Use the E, F, N, and Q between Manhattan and Queens.
